title: Fertility rate forecast
text: age-specific fertility rate forecast modeled four steps: Cumulate, standardize: age-specific fertility rate (see input data preparation) cumulated standardized values 0 1. cumulated standardized value called y*y*. Regression: First, y*y* transformed. , fifth-degree regression fitted y*y* vs. xx (.e. age + 0.5). parameters a0a_0, …, a5a_5 regression estimated. $$ y = \log(-\log(y^*)) \\ x = age + 0.5 \\ y = a_0 + a_1 x + a_2 x^2 + a_3 x^3 + a_4 x^4 + a_5 x^5 $$ Optimization: step, previously calculated MAB forecast used (MAB prediction year future). regression , parameters kept constant except a0a_0. every year future, value a0a_0 changed (intercept, regression coefficients kept constant). done every year y-values (back transformed fertility rates) result previously calculated MAB forecast. Reverse: step, TFR forecast calculated earlier applied. standardized fertility rate multiplied TFR forecast. result get future age-specific fertility rates. model structure

title: Fertility rate forecast
text: Create input data TFR forecast  MAB forecast  Forecast age-specific fertility rate Plot year x-axis  Plot age x-axis
code: library(ggplot2) library(propopbirth) library(dplyr) input <- create_input_data(   population = fso_pop,   births = fso_birth |>     dplyr::filter(spatial_unit %in% c("Aarau", "Frauenfeld", "Stadt Zürich")),   year_first = 2011,   year_last = 2023,   age_fert_min = 15,   age_fert_max = 49,   fert_hist_years = 3,   binational = TRUE ) forecast_tfr <- forecast_tfr_mab(   topic = "tfr",   topic_data = input$tfr,   trend_model = c(     model = "lm", start = 2024, end = 2026, trend_past = 7, trend_prop = 0.5   ),   temporal_model = c(     model = "cubic", start = 2027, end = 2055, trend_prop = 0.8, z0_prop = 0.7,     z1_prop = 0   ),   temporal_end = NA,   constant_model = c(model = "constant", start = 2056, end = 2075) ) ggplot(forecast_tfr) +   geom_line(aes(x = year, y = tfr, color = category)) +   geom_point(aes(x = year, y = tfr, color = category)) +   facet_grid(nat ~ spatial_unit) +   theme_minimal() forecast_mab <- forecast_tfr_mab(   topic = "mab",   topic_data = input$mab,   trend_model = c(     model = "lm", start = 2024, end = 2026, trend_past = 7, trend_prop = 0.5   ),   temporal_model = c(     model = "Bezier", start = 2027, end = 2055, trend_prop = 0.3, z0_prop = 0.7,     z1_prop = 0   ),   temporal_end = NA,   constant_model = c(model = "constant", start = 2056, end = 2075) ) ggplot(forecast_mab) +   geom_line(aes(x = year, y = mab, color = category)) +   geom_point(aes(x = year, y = mab, color = category)) +   facet_grid(nat ~ spatial_unit) +   theme_minimal() forecast_fer <- forecast_fertility_rate(   fer_dat = input$fer,   tfr_dat = forecast_tfr,   mab_dat = forecast_mab,   year_start = 2024,   year_end = 2075 ) forecast_fer |>   DT::datatable(options = list(pageLength = 5)) y_last <- max(input[["fer_y"]]$year)  forecast_fer |>   bind_rows(input$fer_y) |>   filter(age %% 5 == 0) |>   mutate(age = factor(age)) |>   ggplot() +   geom_vline(xintercept = y_last + 1, linetype = 2) +   geom_line(aes(year, birth_rate, color = age)) +   facet_grid(nat ~ spatial_unit) forecast_fer |>   bind_rows(input$fer_y) |>   filter(year %% 10 == 0) |>   mutate(year = factor(year)) |>   ggplot() +   geom_line(aes(age, birth_rate, color = year)) +   facet_grid(nat ~ spatial_unit)

title: TFR and MAB forecast
text: input data preparation, forecasts TFR (total fertility rate) MAB (mean age mother birth) calculated. general, FSO uses model structure forecasts. However, different model types parameters can used TFR MAB forecast. FSO model TFR MAB consists three time periods trend period: FSO model usually years (one five years) temporal period: majority forecast period (FSO: approximately 2055) constant period: end forecast (FSO: 2056 2075) time periods

title: TFR and MAB forecast
text: original FSO model, trend model ARIMA model used trend period. Depending structure past TFR MAB data, ARIMA forecast always stable. Therefore, propopbirth linear model can used alternative ARIMA model. lm model used, window past years (trend_past) proportional amount past years used fit model (trend_prop) can specified.allows weighted selective emphasis recent data calculating trend, can useful trends expected change time older data considered less relevant. topic: “TFR” “MAB” input_dataset: input$tfr input$mab trend_model: “ARIMA” year_begin: first year ARIMA forecast year_end: last year ARIMA forecast trend_prop: proportion ARIMA forecast used. Number 0 1 (1 = ARIMA prediction, 0 = last data value, 0.5 = mean ARIMA prediction last data value) topic: “TFR” “MAB” input_dataset: input$tfr input$mab trend_model: “lm” year_begin: first year linear model forecast year_end: last year linear model forecast trend_past: many past years used fit model? trend_prop: proportion ARIMA forecast used. Number 0 1 (1 = ARIMA prediction, 0 = last data value, 0.5 = mean ARIMA prediction last data value)

title: TFR and MAB forecast
text: general, FSO uses given values TFR MAB end temporal period. target points less subjectively determined cantons. cantonal forecasts manageable. However, often possible meaningful (e.g. forecasts many municipalities spatial units). Therefore, provide propopbirth additional data-driven approach. approach, target points temporal period (point C figure ) derived using trend period model. parameter determines, much trend model used calculate target point C. Example: parameter 0.7 means: 70 % trend projected future determine point C. target point data driven approach temporal period approaches possible given values: table target values provided (group, e.g. spatial unit nationality). data-driven approach: proportion trend selected (parameter e.g. 0.7) FSO uses three alternative modules temporal period: temporal_model: “cubic” year_begin: first year cubic forecast year_end: last year cubic forecast trend_prop: proportion trend derive target point; specified data driven approach temporal_end: given target points; specified given values end temporal period used z0_prop: Bézier function uses slope starting point temporal period. calculated trend period model. parameter z0_prop proportion calculated slope used slope curve starting point. parameter responsible curve shape transition trend temporal period. z1_prop: Bézier function also uses slope end point temporal period. parameter z1_prop proportion previously calculated slope (according trend model) used slope curve end point. parameter responsible curve shape transition temporal constant period. temporal_model: “Bezier” year_begin: first year Bézier forecast year_end: last year Bézier forecast trend_prop: proportion trend derive target point; specified data driven approach temporal_end: given target points; specified given values end temporal period used z0_prop: proportion slope starting point (cubic module) z1_prop: proportion slope end point (cubic module) temporal_model: “constant” year_begin: first year cubic forecast year_end: last year cubic forecast

title: TFR and MAB forecast
text: last section TFR MAB forecast FSO uses constant model. constant_model: “constant” year_begin: first year forecast year_end: last year forecast

title: TFR and MAB forecast
text: Create input data
code: library(propopbirth) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr)  # load package data data("fso_pop") data("fso_birth") input <- create_input_data(   population = fso_pop,   births = fso_birth,   year_first = 2011,   year_last = 2023,   age_fert_min = 15,   age_fert_max = 49,   fert_hist_years = 3,   binational = TRUE )

title: TFR and MAB forecast
text: topic: TFR forecast approach: given target points trend model: linear temporal model: cubic Given target points (subjectively selected values) TFR forecast
code: temporal_end_tfr <- tidyr::expand_grid(   spatial_unit = c("Aarau", "Frauenfeld", "Stadt Zürich"),    nat = c("ch", "int")) |>    dplyr::mutate(y_end = c(0.8, 1.5, 0.8, 2.0, 0.9, 0.9)) forecast_tfr_example1 <- forecast_tfr_mab(   topic = "tfr",    topic_data = input$tfr,   trend_model = c(     model = "lm", start = 2024, end = 2026, trend_past = 7, trend_prop = 0.5   ),   temporal_model = c(     model = "cubic", start = 2027, end = 2055, trend_prop = 0.8, z0_prop = 0.7,      z1_prop = 0   ),   temporal_end = temporal_end_tfr,   constant_model = c(model = "constant", start = 2056, end = 2075) ) ggplot(forecast_tfr_example1) +   geom_line(aes(x = year, y = tfr, color = category)) +   geom_point(aes(x = year, y = tfr, color = category)) +   facet_grid(nat ~ spatial_unit) +   theme_minimal()

title: TFR and MAB forecast
text: topic: TFR forecast approach: data-driven trend model: ARIMA temporal model: Bézier
code: forecast_tfr_example2 <- forecast_tfr_mab(   topic = "tfr",    topic_data = input$tfr,   trend_model = c(     model = "ARIMA", start = 2024, end = 2026, trend_past = 7, trend_prop = 0.5   ),   temporal_model = c(     model = "Bezier", start = 2027, end = 2055, trend_prop = 0.8, z0_prop = 0.7,      z1_prop = 0   ),   temporal_end = NA,   constant_model = c(model = "constant", start = 2056, end = 2075)   )  #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'quantmod': #>   method            from #>   as.zoo.data.frame zoo ggplot(forecast_tfr_example2) +   geom_line(aes(x = year, y = tfr, color = category)) +   geom_point(aes(x = year, y = tfr, color = category)) +   facet_grid(nat ~ spatial_unit) +   theme_minimal()

title: TFR and MAB forecast
text: topic: MAB forecast approach: data-driven trend model: linear temporal model: Bézier
code: forecast_tfr_example3 <- forecast_tfr_mab(   topic = "mab",    topic_data = input$mab,   trend_model = c(     model = "lm", start = 2024, end = 2026, trend_past = 7, trend_prop = 0.5   ),   temporal_model = c(     model = "Bezier", start = 2027, end = 2055, trend_prop = 0.3, z0_prop = 0.7,      z1_prop = 0   ),   temporal_end = NA,   constant_model = c(model = "constant", start = 2056, end = 2075) ) ggplot(forecast_tfr_example3) +   geom_line(aes(x = year, y = mab, color = category)) +   geom_point(aes(x = year, y = mab, color = category)) +   facet_grid(nat ~ spatial_unit) +   theme_minimal()

title: Prepare input data
text: birth rate forecast according methodology FSO (Federal Statistical Office) used. first step prepare model input data. described vignette. starting point past birth population data. Three input data sets prepared: TFR (total fertility rate) per year MAB (mean age mother birth) per year fertility rate per age year final forecast distinguish nationality /spatial unit, three input data sets must also differentiated according variables.

title: Prepare input data
text: need birth population data past prepare input data. don’t data hand, can run functions example data. Regardless whether bring use example data, structure data frames require following variables: year e.g. 2010 2023 FSO’s birth data spatial_unit one (e.g. canton) several (e.g. municipalities) spatial units nat nationality, suggestion: ‘ch’ (Swiss) ‘int’ (international) {propop} package, categories one level also possible age age mother birth births number births year e.g. 2010 2023 FSO’s birth data spatial_unit one (e.g. Canton) several (e.g. municipalities) spatial units nat nationality; suggestion: ‘ch’ (Swiss) ‘int’ (international) {propop} package, categories one level also possible age age females n_pop number people

title: Prepare input data
text: Currently, FSO publish historical births data open data. However, received permission use publish data propopbirth. propopbirth package, original data FSO preprocessed, adapting column names factor levels, municipality numbers replaced municipality names. data three selected municipalities looks like :
code: # load package data data("fso_birth", package = "propopbirth")  fso_birth |>   dplyr::filter(spatial_unit %in% c("Aarau", "Frauenfeld", "Stadt Zürich")) |>   DT::datatable(options = list(pageLength = 5))

title: Prepare input data
text: Historical population records FSO can obtained function propopbirth::get_population_data, defining time span, spatial units specific arguments: data three selected municipalities looks like :
code: fso_pop <- get_population_data(   number_fso = "px-x-0102010000_101",   year_first = 2010,   year_last = 2023,   age_fert_min = 15,   age_fert_max = 49,   spatial_code = c("4001", "4566", "0261"),   spatial_unit = c("Aarau", "Frauenfeld", "Stadt Zürich"),   binational = TRUE ) fso_pop |>   DT::datatable(options = list(pageLength = 5))

title: Prepare input data
text: First, mean annual population calculated females within -called ‘fertile age’ (usually 15 49). group (e.g. spatial unit, age, nationality) year mean population calculated average population beginning end year. Second, births per year group (e.g. spatial unit, age, nationality) divided mean population (number women group). gives age-specific fertility rate per year group. TFR (total fertility rate) calculated sum age-specific fertility rate age per year group (spatial unit, nationality). MAB (mean age mother birth) also computed based age-specific fertility rate per year. calculation weighted average age used. parameter fert_hist_years determines many years used calculate average age-specific fertility rate. FSO usually uses one year cantonal calculations. However, age-specific fertility rates can vary substantially year year, especially small spatial units. Therefore, makes sense take average multiple years. computation births population averaged years; ratio births population calculated.
code: input <- create_input_data(   population = fso_pop,   births = fso_birth |>      dplyr::filter(spatial_unit %in% c("Aarau", "Frauenfeld", "Stadt Zürich")),   year_first = 2011,   year_last = 2023,   age_fert_min = 15,   age_fert_max = 49,   fert_hist_years = 3,   binational = TRUE )

title: Prepare input data
code: ggplot(input$tfr) +   geom_line(aes(x = year, y = tfr, color = nat)) +   facet_wrap(~ spatial_unit) +   theme_minimal() input$tfr |>    DT::datatable(options = list(pageLength = 5))

title: Prepare input data
code: ggplot(input$mab) +   geom_line(aes(x = year, y = mab, color = nat)) +   facet_wrap(~ spatial_unit)+   theme_minimal() input$mab |>    DT::datatable(options = list(pageLength = 5))

title: Prepare input data
code: ggplot(input$fer) +   geom_line(aes(x = age, y = fer, color = nat)) +   facet_wrap(~ spatial_unit)+   theme_minimal() input$fer |>    DT::datatable(options = list(pageLength = 5))

title: Authors and Citation
text: Klemens Rosin. Author. Felix Lorenz. Author. Norah Efosa. Author, maintainer. Felix Luginbuhl. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rosin K, Lorenz F, Efosa N (2025). propopbirth: Birth rate forecast based FSO methodology. R package version 0.1.0, https://statistik-aargau.github.io/propopbirth_test/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {propopbirth: Birth rate forecast based on the FSO methodology},   author = {Klemens Rosin and Felix Lorenz and Norah Efosa},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://statistik-aargau.github.io/propopbirth_test/}, }

what: Birth rate forecast based on the FSO methodology
title: Birth rate forecast based on the FSO methodology
text: Birth rate forecasts based FSO (Federal Statistical Office) methodology.

title: Birth rate forecast based on the FSO methodology
text: propopbirth package consists several modules: First, model input data calculated. Second, TFR (total fertility rate) MAB (mean age mother birth) predicted. Third, TFR MAB forecasts used predict age-specific birth rates.

title: Birth rate forecast based on the FSO methodology
text: output propopbirth fully compatible {propop} - R package population projections R. {propop} needs future birth rates input. available FSO cantonal level. propopbirth birth rates can also calculated spatial units hypothesis.

title: Birth rate forecast based on the FSO methodology
text: install current github version package, make sure devtools installed type:
code: devtools::install_github("statistik-aargau/propopbirth")

title: Birth rate forecast based on the FSO methodology
text: package includes three vignettes. Vignette 1: Prepare model input data birth population, examples Vignette 2: Forecast TFR (total fertility rate) MAB (mean age mother birth), examples Vignette 3: Forecast age-specific fertility rate; including example complete forecast birth rate

title: Birth rate forecast based on the FSO methodology
text: population scenario models, always necessary check whether spatial units large enough ensure meaningful forecast estimates. population limit specification FSO, run forecast models. However, visual checks advisable (graphs see vignettes examples). helpful verify whether estimates birth rate forecasts meaningful.

title: Birth rate forecast based on the FSO methodology
text: Currently, FSO birth data accessible required variables. reason, birth data included propopbirth package. soon birth data publicly accessible (similar population data), directly accessible propopbirth . allow flexible selection spatial units (municipalities, also districts).

title: Birth rate forecast based on the FSO methodology
text: Detailed examples explanations provided vignettes (step step). example entire birth rate forecast three municipalities.

title: Birth rate forecast based on the FSO methodology
text: {r setup, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE} library(ggplot2) library(propopbirth) library(dplyr)

title: Birth rate forecast based on the FSO methodology
text: {r, echo = TRUE} input <- create_input_data(   population = fso_pop,   births = fso_birth |>      dplyr::filter(spatial_unit %% c("Aarau", "Frauenfeld", "Stadt Zürich")),   year_first = 2011,   year_last = 2023,   age_fert_min = 15,   age_fert_max = 49,   fert_hist_years = 3,   binational = TRUE )

title: Birth rate forecast based on the FSO methodology
text: {r, echo = TRUE} forecast_tfr <- forecast_tfr_mab(   topic = "tfr",   topic_data = input$tfr,   trend_model = c(     model = "lm", start = 2024, end = 2026, trend_past = 7, trend_prop = 0.5   ),   temporal_model = c(     model = "cubic", start = 2027, end = 2055, trend_prop = 0.8, z0_prop = 0.7,     z1_prop = 0   ),   temporal_end = NA,   constant_model = c(model = "constant", start = 2056, end = 2075) )

what: MAB (mean age of the mother at birth) forecast
title: Birth rate forecast based on the FSO methodology
text: {r, echo = TRUE} forecast_mab <- forecast_tfr_mab(   topic = "mab",   topic_data = input$mab,   trend_model = c(     model = "lm", start = 2024, end = 2026, trend_past = 7, trend_prop = 0.5   ),   temporal_model = c(     model = "Bezier", start = 2027, end = 2055, trend_prop = 0.3, z0_prop = 0.7,     z1_prop = 0   ),   temporal_end = NA,   constant_model = c(model = "constant", start = 2056, end = 2075) )

what: Forecast of the age-specific fertility rate
title: Birth rate forecast based on the FSO methodology
text: {r, echo = TRUE} forecast_fer <- forecast_fertility_rate(   fer_dat = input$fer,   tfr_dat = forecast_tfr,   mab_dat = forecast_mab,    year_begin = 2024,    year_end = 2075)

title: Birth rate forecast based on the FSO methodology
text: acknowledge Federal Statistical Office (FSO) providing SAS code used fertility projections. grateful FSO giving permission use birth data within propopbirth package.

title: Create model input data — create_input_data
text: Create model input data

title: Create model input data — create_input_data
code: create_input_data(   population,   births,   year_first,   year_last,   age_fert_min,   age_fert_max,   fert_hist_years,   binational = TRUE,   digits_tfr = 3,   digits_mab = 3,   digits_fer = 5 )

title: Create model input data — create_input_data
text: population data frame, female population 'fertile age'; columns: spatial_unit, year, age, pop, without nat (nationality). births data frame, births females fertile age range; columns: spatial_unit, year, age, pop, without nat (nationality). year_first numeric, first year. year_last numeric, last year. age_fert_min numeric, minimum age ('fertile age'). age_fert_max numeric, minimum age ('fertile age'). fert_hist_years many years used calculate age-specific fertility rates? binational boolean, TRUE indicates projections discriminate two groups nationalities. FALSE indicates projection run without distinguishing nationalities. digits_tfr numeric, number digits tfr (total fertility rate). digits_mab numeric, number digits mab (mean age mother birth). digits_fer numeric, number digits fertility rate.

title: Create model input data — create_input_data
text: list : tfr (total fertility rate), mab (mean age mother birth), fer (fertility rate last year(s))

title: Create model input data — create_input_data
code: create_input_data(   population = fso_pop,   births = fso_birth |>     dplyr::filter(spatial_unit %in% c("Stadt Zuerich", "Frauenfeld", "Aarau")),   year_first = 2011,   year_last = 2023,   age_fert_min = 15,   age_fert_max = 49,   fert_hist_years = 1,   binational = TRUE ) #> $tfr #> # A tibble: 78 × 4 #>    spatial_unit nat    year   tfr #>    <chr>        <chr> <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Aarau        ch     2011  1.33 #>  2 Aarau        ch     2012  1.29 #>  3 Aarau        ch     2013  1.31 #>  4 Aarau        ch     2014  1.11 #>  5 Aarau        ch     2015  1.31 #>  6 Aarau        ch     2016  1.56 #>  7 Aarau        ch     2017  1.16 #>  8 Aarau        ch     2018  1.13 #>  9 Aarau        ch     2019  1.24 #> 10 Aarau        ch     2020  1.20 #> # ℹ 68 more rows #>  #> $mab #> # A tibble: 78 × 4 #>    spatial_unit nat    year   mab #>    <chr>        <chr> <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Aarau        ch     2011  32.7 #>  2 Aarau        ch     2012  31.8 #>  3 Aarau        ch     2013  33.2 #>  4 Aarau        ch     2014  33.4 #>  5 Aarau        ch     2015  33.8 #>  6 Aarau        ch     2016  33.8 #>  7 Aarau        ch     2017  33.7 #>  8 Aarau        ch     2018  33.8 #>  9 Aarau        ch     2019  33.2 #> 10 Aarau        ch     2020  33.3 #> # ℹ 68 more rows #>  #> $fer #> # A tibble: 210 × 4 #>    spatial_unit nat     age    fer #>    <chr>        <chr> <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1 Aarau        ch       15 0      #>  2 Aarau        ch       16 0      #>  3 Aarau        ch       17 0      #>  4 Aarau        ch       18 0      #>  5 Aarau        ch       19 0      #>  6 Aarau        ch       20 0      #>  7 Aarau        ch       21 0      #>  8 Aarau        ch       22 0.0108 #>  9 Aarau        ch       23 0.0114 #> 10 Aarau        ch       24 0      #> # ℹ 200 more rows #>  #> $fer_y #> # A tibble: 2,730 × 5 #>    spatial_unit nat    year   age birth_rate #>    <chr>        <chr> <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl> #>  1 Aarau        ch     2011    15    0       #>  2 Aarau        ch     2011    16    0       #>  3 Aarau        ch     2011    17    0       #>  4 Aarau        ch     2011    18    0       #>  5 Aarau        ch     2011    19    0       #>  6 Aarau        ch     2011    20    0       #>  7 Aarau        ch     2011    21    0       #>  8 Aarau        ch     2011    22    0.0253  #>  9 Aarau        ch     2011    23    0.00930 #> 10 Aarau        ch     2011    24    0.0154  #> # ℹ 2,720 more rows #>

title: Forecast age-specific fertility rates. — forecast_fertility_rate
text: Forecast age-specific fertility rates.

title: Forecast age-specific fertility rates. — forecast_fertility_rate
code: forecast_fertility_rate(   fer_dat,   tfr_dat,   mab_dat,   year_start,   year_end,   maxit = 1000,   abstol = 0.001,   digits_birth_rate = 5 )

title: Forecast age-specific fertility rates. — forecast_fertility_rate
text: fer_dat data frame, fertility data, tibble variables spatial_unit, nat, age, fer. tfr_dat tfr data, tibble variables spatial_unit, nat, year, tfr. mab_dat mab data, tibble variables spatial_unit, nat, year, mab. year_start numeric, start prediction. year_end numeric, end prediction. maxit numeric, maximum iterations optimization. abstol numeric, absolute tolerance optimization. digits_birth_rate numeric, number digits birth rate.

title: Forecast age-specific fertility rates. — forecast_fertility_rate
text: birth rate, tibble variables spatial_unit, nat, age, birth_rate.

what: Forecast total fertility rate (TFR) or mean age of the mother at birth (MAB) — forecast_tfr_mab
title: Forecast total fertility rate (TFR) or mean age of the mother at birth (MAB) — forecast_tfr_mab
text: Forecast total fertility rate (TFR) mean age mother birth (MAB)

title: Forecast total fertility rate (TFR) or mean age of the mother at birth (MAB) — forecast_tfr_mab
code: forecast_tfr_mab(   topic,   topic_data,   trend_model,   temporal_model,   temporal_end = NA,   constant_model )

title: Forecast total fertility rate (TFR) or mean age of the mother at birth (MAB) — forecast_tfr_mab
text: topic character, defines parameter calculate (tfr mab). topic_data data frame, input data tailored topic variables: spatial_unit, nat, year, either tfr mab. data obtained function create_input_data(). Columns spatial_unit /nat optional. trend_model vector, specifies model type (ARIMA lm), first (start) last (end) year. lm model used, window past years (trend_past) proportional amount past years used fit model (trend_prop) can specified. temporal_model vector, model type (cubic, Bezier constant), first last year, proportion trend (trend_prop), proportion slopes (z0_prop) proportion slope end point (z1_prop). temporal_end data frame, contains y-values end temporal forecast period (y_end). constant_model model type (constant), first last year.

title: Forecast total fertility rate (TFR) or mean age of the mother at birth (MAB) — forecast_tfr_mab
text: data frame, predictions either tfr mab.

text: Get FSO population (females 'fertile' age)

title: Get FSO population (females at 'fertile' age) — get_population_data
code: get_population_data(   number_fso,   year_first,   year_last,   age_fert_min,   age_fert_max,   spatial_code,   spatial_unit,   binational = TRUE )

title: Get FSO population (females at 'fertile' age) — get_population_data
text: number_fso character, number FSO table (STAT-TAB) year_first numeric, first year. year_last numeric, last year. age_fert_min numeric, minimum age ('fertile age'). age_fert_max numeric, maximum age ('fertile age'). spatial_code character, vector, official FSO codes. spatial_unit character, vector, spatial unit names (free choice). binational boolean, TRUE indicates projections discriminate two groups nationalities. FALSE indicates projection run without distinguishing nationalities.

title: Get FSO population (females at 'fertile' age) — get_population_data
text: female population 'fertile age' end year, tibble (spatial_unit, year, age, pop), without nat (nationality)

title: Get FSO population (females at 'fertile' age) — get_population_data
code: get_population_data(   number_fso = "px-x-0102010000_101",   year_first = 2020,   year_last = 2023,   age_fert_min = 15,   age_fert_max = 49,   spatial_code = c("0261", "4566", "4001"),   spatial_unit = c("Stadt Zuerich", "Frauenfeld", "Aarau"),   binational = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 840 × 5 #>     year spatial_unit nat     age n_pop #>    <dbl> <chr>        <chr> <dbl> <dbl> #>  1  2020 Aarau        ch       15    64 #>  2  2020 Aarau        ch       16    69 #>  3  2020 Aarau        ch       17    72 #>  4  2020 Aarau        ch       18    64 #>  5  2020 Aarau        ch       19    68 #>  6  2020 Aarau        ch       20    69 #>  7  2020 Aarau        ch       21    78 #>  8  2020 Aarau        ch       22    84 #>  9  2020 Aarau        ch       23    89 #> 10  2020 Aarau        ch       24   134 #> # ℹ 830 more rows
